body_html: @RylanSchaeffer, what's state, what is the output of type(state)? If I had to guess, maybe you changed from LSTM cell to GRU. Some functions, like tf.nn.dynamic_rnn, return a pair of (output, state), where state is LSTMStateTuple if you are using an LSTM cell, (which have c and h), but a Tensor if using a GRU cell.
body_text: @RylanSchaeffer, what's state, what is the output of type(state)? If I had to guess, maybe you changed from LSTM cell to GRU. Some functions, like tf.nn.dynamic_rnn, return a pair of (output, state), where state is LSTMStateTuple if you are using an LSTM cell, (which have c and h), but a Tensor if using a GRU cell.
body: @RylanSchaeffer, what's `state`, what is the output of `type(state)`? If I had to guess, maybe you changed from LSTM cell to GRU. Some functions, like tf.nn.dynamic_rnn, return a pair of (output, state), where `state` is LSTMStateTuple if you are using an LSTM cell, (which have `c` and `h`), but a Tensor if using a GRU cell.
